description: Test code for arrays and dictionaries - runs a suite of tests on your calculator.
source:
# Test code for arrays and dictionaries
def t1():
  
  # List tests
  b = [1,2,3]
  b.append(4)
  passert(b[0] == 1)
  passert(b[1] == 2)
  passert(b[2] == 3)
  passert(b[3] == 4)
  passert(b[-1] == 4)
  b[2] = 333
  passert(b[2] == 333)
  passert(b[-2] == 333)
  b2 = b
  passert(b[0] == 1)
  passert(b[-4] == 1)
  b = [1,2,3]
  passert(len(b) == 3)
  passert(b[-1] == 3)
  b.pop()
  passert(b[-1] == 2)
  
  # Dictionary tests
  d = {1:11,5:22}
  passert(d[5] == 22)
  passert(d[1] == 11)
  d[1] = 88
  passert(d[1] == 88)
  d[6] = 66
  passert(d[6] == 66)
  passert(d[5] == 22)
  passert(d[1] == 88)
  #PROMPT(A[1])
  #PROMPT(A[222])

  # Alpha Dictionary tests
  d = {'first':11,'second':22}
  passert(d['second'] == 22)
  passert(d['first'] == 11)
  d['another'] = 33
  passert(d['another'] == 33)
  
  print("all tests pass")
title: Test code for arrays and dictionaries
